definition: A vocal expression used to attract attention, typically employed in situations where one person wishes to communicate with another person who is at a distance or out of sight. It is commonly used outdoors or in open spaces to call someone's name or to signal for assistance.

examples.german: Er rief den Namen des Gewinners aus.
examples.english: He announced the name of the winner.

examples.german: Sie rief um Hilfe, als sie den Unfall sah.
examples.english: She called for help when she saw the accident.

examples.german: Wir rufen unsere Freunde an, um sie einzuladen.
examples.english: We call our friends to invite them.

examples.german: Der Lehrer rief die Schüler zur Ruhe auf.
examples.english: The teacher called the students to be quiet.
